thread.title: Five teenagers arrested in London on suspicion of planning to join ISIS
thread.title_full: Five teenagers arrested in London on suspicion of planning to join ISIS

author: hcrouch
title: Five teenagers arrested in London on suspicion of planning to join ISIS
text:
Comments FIVE teenagers have been arrested in London on suspicion of joining a “proscribed organisation” like ISIS. 
The five males, aged between 15 and 19, were arrested today the Metropolitan Police has said. PA:Press Association 1 FIVE teenagers have been arrested in London on suspicion of the preparation of terrorist acts – the Metropolitan Police has said 
Two were arrested at separate residential addresses in south London, two were arrested at a residential address in west London and the fifth was arrested at an address in east London. 
The arrests relate to plans to travel to join a proscribed organisation. 
All five have been detained under TACT and are at present in a central London police station pending further enquiries. RELATED STORIES Mercedes among top firms 'unintentionally funding terrorism' after adverts appear on propaganda vids terror trial begins Swansea man to appear in court charged with five terrorism offences TERROR ARREST Woman, 51, arrested on suspicion of funding terrorism in Syria TERROR TRIAL Parents of 'Jihadi Jack' arrive at court to face trial for funding terrorism by sending him money BAD WAY TO PLAY HOOKY Teen facing terrorism charges after calling in fake bomb threat to school so pal got out of class 
Last week a 36-year-old man who was arrested at Heathrow Airport on suspicion of preparing terrorist acts was bailed by police. 
He was detained under anti-terrorism legislation as he arrived at the airport. 
The suspect has since been questioned at a west London police station and released on bail to a date in mid-May. 
Britain’s terror alert is currently at “severe” and top lawyers have warned of the wide range of threats we face.
